sub_subject.name: Industry & Professional Practice
sub_subject.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Industry & Professional Practice (Design & Technology)

objectives.objective_text: Identify the Golden Arches (McDonalds).
Name a favorite cereal box.
Identify asking friends to help buy a gift.
Name a new idea as a 'Startup'.
Identify Kickstarter or GoFundMe.
Identify a banana from another country.
Name a big ship carrying boxes.
Identify 'Food Miles'.
Identify a toy that broke quickly.
Name an old thing that still works (Grandma's clock).
Identify fashion trends as psychological obsolescence.
Identify a machine doing a person's job (dishwasher).
Name a robot helper.
Identify jobs that robots can't do (caring/art).
Identify a ramp for a wheelchair.
Name glasses that help people see.
Identify assistive technology.
Identify digging in the ground for treasure.
Name gold and diamonds.
Identify unsafe working conditions.
Identify a tray of cookies (all made together).
Name a group of things as a 'Batch'.
Identify products made in seasonal batches (Easter eggs).
Identify ordering a pizza (it's made when you ask).
Name a store running out of toys.
Identify the risk (if the truck is late, we stop).
Identify a factory with machines.
Name a car assembly line.
Identify Continuous Production (24/7, like paper or electricity).
Identify a handmade gift.
Name a person who makes things one at a time (tailor/baker).
Identify a prototype as a one-off.
Recall that bright colors make us look.
Observe that packaging protects the toy.
Recall that we need money to start making things.
Observe a collection jar.
Recall that planes fly mail to us.
Observe a 'Made in China' sticker.
Recall that we have to buy new batteries.
Observe that some things are made to be thrown away.
Recall that computers are smart.
Observe a self-checkout at the store.
Recall that everyone is different.
Observe signs with Braille.
Recall that workers need to be safe.
Observe that we should pay people fairly.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Identify that we should make safe toys.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Name taking care of the world.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Identify waste reduction as stewardship.
Recall that we use a cutter to make them the same shape.
Observe books in a library.
Recall that food goes bad if we keep it too long.
Observe a delivery truck.
Recall that robots can work without sleeping.
Observe identical soda cans.
Recall that making things by hand takes time.
Observe that no two handmade things are exactly the same.
Summarize what a Brand is (personality of a company).
Explain why packaging needs information (ingredients).
Explain the 'unboxing experience'.
Defend the cost of premium packaging for high-end goods.
Summarize Crowdfunding (many people giving a little).
Explain what a 'Backer' gets (early product).
Explain Equity vs. Reward crowdfunding.
Defend the transparency required for crowdfunding.
Summarize how parts come from all over the world.
Explain what a Shipping Container is.
Trace the journey of a t-shirt.
Explain the role of distribution centers.
Defend the resilience vs. efficiency of supply chains.
Summarize why companies want us to buy new things.
Explain 'Planned Obsolescence' (designed to fail/get old).
Explain the difference between technological and functional obsolescence.
Defend the design of modular, repairable products.
Summarize how robots help in dangerous places.
Explain that machines work faster than people.
Explain the need for retraining/upskilling.
Defend the human element in craftsmanship.
Summarize 'Inclusive Design' (designing for everyone).
Explain how a wide door helps a stroller and a wheelchair.
Explain Universal Design principles.
Defend the dignity of all users in design.
Summarize 'Fair Trade' (paying a fair price).
Explain that phones have rare metals inside.
Explain the environmental damage of open-pit mining.
Defend the moral obligation of the designer to know the source.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that God wants us to be kind.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that we shouldn't waste things.
Summarize how a bakery makes bread rolls.
Explain what a 'Template' is (drawing around a shape).
Explain the downtime between batches.
Defend the use of CNC for flexible batch manufacturing.
Summarize 'Just in Time' (getting parts right when needed).
Explain why storage costs money (renting space).
Explain the Toyota Production System origins.
Defend the environmental benefits of reduced inventory.
Summarize Mass Production (making millions of the same thing).
Explain the Assembly Line (Henry Ford).
Explain the consequences of a line stoppage.
Defend the necessity of mass production for affordable goods.
Summarize 'Bespoke' (made specially for one person).
Explain why a custom suit costs more than a store-bought one.
Explain the role of the artisan.
Defend the high unit cost based on skilled labor.
Compare a generic brand with a famous brand.
Analyze the psychology of color in branding.
Interpret brand loyalty.
Connect packaging design to sustainability (waste).
Compare a bank loan with crowdfunding.
Analyze the pitch video's role in success.
Interpret the risks of backing a project (it might fail).
Connect social media sharing to viral marketing.
Analyze the complexity of global logistics.
Interpret the impact of the Suez Canal blockage.
Connect outsourcing to cheaper labor costs.
Compare a disposable camera with a digital one.
Analyze the 'Right to Repair' movement.
Interpret the environmental cost of fast fashion.
Connect durability to brand reputation.
Compare a handmade shoe with a factory shoe.
Analyze the shift from manual labor to knowledge work.
Interpret the fear of 'technological unemployment'.
Connect AI to creative fields.
Compare a difficult jar lid with an easy one.
Analyze the exclusion caused by bad design.
Interpret the 'Curb Cut Effect' (helps everyone).
Connect aging populations to design needs.
Compare ethical chocolate with regular chocolate.
Analyze the concept of 'Conflict Minerals'.
Interpret the supply chain transparency.
Connect consumer choice to worker welfare.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the duty to do no harm.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why we test products before selling.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Explain 'Greenwashing'.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the Christian mandate to cultivate the creation.
Compare making one vs. making ten.
Analyze the efficiency of using Jigs (guides for tools).
Interpret the flexibility of batch production (changing colors).
Connect fixtures to accuracy.
Compare a warehouse full of stuff vs. an empty one.
Analyze the reduction of waste (Lean manufacturing).
Interpret the supply chain dependency of JIT.
Connect JIT to cash flow (money not tied up in stock).
Compare a robot worker with a human worker.
Analyze the high setup cost vs. low unit cost.
Interpret the role of automation in quality consistency.
Connect standardization to interchangeable parts.
Compare a painting with a printed poster.
Analyze the labor intensity of one-off production.
Interpret the value of unique craft in a mass market.
Connect architectural models to one-off production.
Evaluate the legal requirements of packaging labeling.
Evaluate the viability of a startup model.
Evaluate the ethical implications of offshore manufacturing.
Evaluate the economic necessity of consumption cycles.
Evaluate the ethical implications of autonomous decision making.
Evaluate compliance with ADA/Equality Act standards.
Evaluate the geopolitical impact of resource extraction.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Compare a selfish design with a helpful one.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the long-term consequences of design choices.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the designer's role in culture making.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Connect safety standards to loving your neighbor.
Evaluate the economic order quantity (EOQ).
Evaluate the vulnerability of JIT to global disruption.
Evaluate the social impact of deskilling labor.
Evaluate the niche market for luxury goods.
Design a logo for a lemonade stand.
Construct a comprehensive brand identity.
Construct a business pitch for a design concept.
Construct a supply chain map for a complex product.
Synthesize geopolitical awareness with industrial management.
Construct a critique of the upgrade culture.
Synthesize ethical design with business longevity.
Construct an argument regarding the future of work.
Synthesize economic theory with technological trends.
Construct a product modification for a specific disability.
Construct a sourcing policy for a design project.
Synthesize human rights awareness with material selection.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the tension between profit and responsibility.
Construct a jig to aid in a batch production run.
Synthesize production planning with inventory control.
Construct a strategy for implementing JIT in a small business.
Synthesize logistics management with production scheduling.
Construct a flow process chart for a mass production line.
Synthesize robotics integration with production flow.
Construct a cost analysis for a bespoke commission.
Synthesize the relationship between customization and production time.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a personal code of ethics for design practice.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Designer's Responsibility (Christian stewardship of resources and safety)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize professional liability with moral vocation.
Synthesize entrepreneurial vision with financial planning.
Synthesize graphic design with structural packaging engineering.
Synthesize empathy with engineering constraints.
